intro: Cissus haullevilleana, commonly known as the African leafcreeper, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Cissus haullevilleana thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
